title: MS NOW — Times Square Broadcast Facility

gallery.caption: Urban loft aesthetic with faux brick and steel columns

summary: Three months. Three studios. One network rebrand. Zero compromises. When MSNBC rebranded as MS NOW and left 30 Rock, Mystic delivered a complete multi-studio broadcast facility in an impossibly compressed timeline.
challenge: MSNBC was forced to leave its home of nearly two decades at 30 Rock due to corporate restructuring. Simultaneously rebranding as 'MS NOW,' the network needed a facility that would maintain broadcast continuity while establishing a fresh visual identity — in three months.
approach: Mystic delivered complete scenic for three studios: 9A (modern/polished with LED ribbon display), 9C (urban/organic with faux brick and circular discussion table), and 9B (full LED volume for virtual production). 1,782 sq ft of LED across all studios.
result: MS NOW debuted November 15, 2025, exactly on schedule — a remarkable achievement given the three-month timeline. Existing shows maintained quality through the rebrand.

testimonial.quote: Timing was, of course, a challenge, but we have an incredible team that built a fully functional and state-of-the-art facility in an incredibly short period of time.
testimonial.author: Andy Barsh
testimonial.title: SVP Creative Operations
